Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Skin peptide tyrosine-tyrosine (Skin-PYY; SPYY; Frogs, amphibians, animals)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-negative bacteria:Aeromonas caviae (MIC=40 µg/ml), Escherichia coli (MIC=10 µg/ml);Gram-positive bacteria:Enterococcus faecalis (MIC=10 µg/ml), Nocardia brasiliensis (MIC=20 µg/ml).Fungi:Cryptococcus neoformans (MIC=20 µg/ml), Candida albicans (MIC=15 µg/ml), Microsporum canis (MIC=10 µg/ml), Tricophyton rubrum (MIC=15 µg/ml), Arthroderma simii (MIC=10 µg/ml), Aspergillus fumigatus (MIC=80 µg/ml), Aspergillus niger (MIC>100 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.Function: Shows a broad spectrum of antibacterial activity against Gram-positive and Gram-negative bacteria, yeast and fungi.

Literature.Title: Skin peptide tyrosine-tyrosine, a member of the pancreatic polypeptide family isolation, structure, synthesis, and endocrine activity.
Literature.Reference: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 1994 Oct 25;91(22)10295-10299.
Literature.Author: Mor A, Chartrel N, Vaudry H, Nicolas P.

Literature.Title: Broad spectrum antibiotic activity of the skin-PYY.
Literature.Author: Vouldoukis I, Shai Y, Nicolas P, Mor A.

Literature.Title: Skin peptide tyrosine-tyrosine, a member of the pancreatic polypeptide family: isolation, structure, synthesis, and endocrine activity.
